text: I thought pluto was a programming environment... but even print doesnt work

elements.text: I thought pluto was a programming environment... but even print doesnt work

text: I believe it's on the list of areas to investigate - <https://www.notion.so/Pluto-jl-a9982e79b7bb4c658e6216c15a9d4cab?p=24e1c517c3f64bbbbcb97499e2539611> - but Pluto.jl is an attempt to create something new and different from older ways of programming, especially for teaching purposes. If it doesn't suit your programming style, you probably shouldn't use it - perhaps you should stick to something more traditional, like Jupyter, perhaps, which can be used in more traditional ways.

attachments.title: a cooler way to print
attachments.text: So I don't think that print(x) debugging is the best that 70 years of computer research can give us. :upside_down_face:
attachments.fallback: malyvsen on Notion: a cooler way to print

elements.text: I believe it's on the list of areas to investigate -

- but Pluto.jl is an attempt to create something new and different from older ways of programming, especially for teaching purposes. If it doesn't suit your programming style, you probably shouldn't use it - perhaps you should stick to something more traditional, like Jupyter, perhaps, which can be used in more traditional ways.

text: There's also a <#C017Z6Q3WS3|pluto> channel here, and even more activity on the Zulip (<https://julialang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/243342-pluto.2Ejl>) which I think is the preferred channel for Plutonian discussions, and where you'll be able to debate your opinions with the developers... :slightly_smiling_face:

attachments.title: JuliaLang
attachments.text: This is the Zulip server for the Julia programming language community. We ask anyone joining to adhere to the Julia Code of Conduct. | To learn more about Julia, check out <https://julialang.org/>, or just come ask us here! | You can reach out to the admins of this Zulip by sending a direct message to @zulip-admins.
